abstract: The timing information for the drawable’s frame.
overview:
## Discussion

This retrieves a frame’s timing information from a drawable instance that represents that frame. For Swift, it’s an alternative to calling a frame’s [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/Frame/predictTiming()] method. For ObjectiveC, it’s an alternative to calling the [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_frame_predict_timing] function.

In ObjectiveC, you can determine when to start updating your data structures by passing a [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_frame_timing_t] instance to the [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_frame_timing_get_optimal_input_time] function.

# frameTiming

**Instance Property**

The timing information for the drawable’s frame.

## Declaration

```swift
var frameTiming: LayerRenderer.Frame.Timing { get }
```

## Discussion

This retrieves a frame’s timing information from a drawable instance that represents that frame. For Swift, it’s an alternative to calling a frame’s [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/Frame/predictTiming()] method. For ObjectiveC, it’s an alternative to calling the [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_frame_predict_timing] function.

In ObjectiveC, you can determine when to start updating your data structures by passing a [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_frame_timing_t] instance to the [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_frame_timing_get_optimal_input_time] function.

## Synchronizing the drawing operation

- **presentationFrameIndex**: The sequential index of a drawable’s frame.
